entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Inches Toward Merger With USBTC as Court Approves Deal
entry.summary: Hut 8 Corp stands to be one of the largest Bitcoin miners across the continent, but the deal isn't finalized yet.

entry.title: Exploring the 'Shared Vocabulary' of Generative Art's History
entry.summary: A new exhibition in London highlights the connections between the early pioneers of generative art and their modern counterparts.

entry.title: Mila Kunis' Stoner Cats Banned From NFT Marketplaces After SEC Charges
entry.summary: OpenSea and Rarible both confirmed that they blocked Stoner Cats NFT trades, while Blur shows no active listings after the SEC settlement.

entry.title: 'House of Mirrors': SEC Demands Urgent Inspection of Binance US Assets
entry.summary: The top regulator has slammed Binance US in Monday court documents for allegedly not cooperating.

entry.title: The Elder Scrolls VI Isn't Coming to PlayStation 5, Won't Release Before 2026
entry.summary: Unlike Skyrim, The Elder Scrolls VI isn't planned for PlayStation. Instead, it'll be a PC and Xbox exclusive, like Starfield.

entry.title: Citigroup Will Let Rich Clients Use Private Blockchain to Transfer Assets
entry.summary: Citigroup is allowing big money clients to transform their deposits into digital tokens.

entry.title: Rising From Ashes: Berlin Bitcoin Veteran Bitwala Makes Surprise Comeback
entry.summary: Once known as Nuri, Berlin-based cryptocurrency startup Bitwala is relaunching under its old name—but German users will have to wait.

entry.title: Deepfake Pornography: Is Consent Over Your Image a Lost Cause?
entry.summary: For many in the areas of cybersecurity, social justice, privacy law, and other fields, deepfake pornography is one of the greatest threats to emerge from the AI era.

entry.title: Hong Kong Influencer Arrested Over JPEX Exchange Promotion
entry.summary: Joseph Lam’s arrest followed the suspension of trading on crypto exchange JPEX, which regulators allege was operating without a license.

entry.title: Blockchain's Unseen Backbone Securing Billions of Dollars in Value
entry.summary: Chronicle Protocol aims to redefine the oracle space with Scribe, when it launches to the public this month.

entry.title: Elizabeth Warren's Digital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Act Gets Nine New Sponsors
entry.summary: Warren's controversial Digital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Act has received support from nine more U.S. senators.

entry.title: Europe is ‘Eating America’s Lunch’: U.S. Held Back by Bitcoin ETF Paralysis
entry.summary: "Europe is probably a bit ahead of the game,” says a Swiss CEO. "The U.S. still has work to do.”

entry.title: Nature, Not Humans, Should Be the Model for AI, Says Artist Collective
entry.summary: Challenging conventional AI ethics, Theta Noir believes AI should mimic nature's sustainability rather than human excess.

entry.title: First Celebrities Settle Lawsuits Over FTX Deals
entry.summary: Among those who agreed to settle were Jacksonville Jaguars quarterback Trevor Lawrence, and YouTube influencers Tom Nash and Kevin Paffrath.

entry.title: PolkaWorld Hits Pause as Founder Faults Polkadot Governance Change
entry.summary: At the center of the controversy is a new structure that grants every token holder a vote.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Idris Elba Falls Flat, and Are We Near the End of Binance?
entry.summary: Several crypto Twitter heads remarked on the shifty personnel changes over at Binance this week.

entry.title: Prosecutors Say SBF’s Lawyers Are Trying to Taint Juror Pool
entry.summary: Ahead of Sam Bankman-Fried's trial, the government objects to voir dire questions from the defense.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Steady Week for Bitcoin and Ethereum, Toncoin Balloons 23%
entry.summary: Not even a big-budget Idris Elba commercial could save Stellar’s XLM from taking a nose dive.

entry.title: Bitcoin Metaverse Token Coming From Animoca Game Studio
entry.summary: Animoca Brands' Darewise subsidiary will launch a metaverse token via Bitcoin Ordinals to power an ecosystem led by the game Life Beyond.

entry.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban Loses $870,000 In Crypto Scam
entry.summary: The owner of the Dallas Mavericks lost roughly $870,000, although the figures could have been much worse.

entry.title: Did Google Ban AI Artists from Running Stable Diffusion on Its Cloud?
entry.summary: Users have claimed that Google banned them from Colab after they tried to run Stable Diffusion with the famous WebUI popularized by A1111.

entry.title: Some Celebrities Are Embracing AI to Stay Ahead of Deepfake Makers
entry.summary: Prominent actors are reportedly using Metaphysic Pro to take ownership of the data needed to reproduce their likenesses.

entry.title: What is KYC? How Crypto Exchanges Prevent Money Laundering
entry.summary: Know-your-customer (KYC) requirements are a growing part of Web3, as crypto becomes more integrated with the existing financial system.

entry.title: North Korea’s Lazarus Group Has Stolen $240M in Crypto in Just 104 Days: Elliptic
entry.summary: Adding to the tally is the $54 million hack of crypto exchange CoinEx, which blockchain sleuths at Elliptic now believe Lazarus was likely behind.

entry.title: Nouns Fork: Disgruntled NFT Holders Exit With $27 Million From Treasury
entry.summary: The Nouns NFT collective on Ethereum, which is building open-source IP by funding creative projects, fractures after a widely supported fork.

entry.title: Judge Grants SEC’s Motion to Unseal Key Documents in Binance Lawsuit
entry.summary: The judge’s approval follows accusations that Binance US exhibited a “lack of transparency” in the SEC’s investigation.

entry.title: Google Gemini Poised to Take On AI Titans OpenAI and Microsoft
entry.summary: Google has reportedly started testing its most advanced AI model to date, Gemini, which it says has impressive multimodal capabilities.

entry.title: London Design Museum Lets Visitors Test Iconic Runway Looks via AR
entry.summary: An augmented reality experience developed by Snapchat maker Snap is part of the museum's new "Rebel: 30 Years of London Fashion" exhibit.

entry.title: Crypto Companies Aren't Banks, Hong Kong Warns Investors
entry.summary: “Describing themselves as banks may mislead the public into entrusting the companies with their savings,” read the regulator's notice.

entry.title: PUBG Creator Krafton Unveils 'Overdare' NFT Game With AI Creation Tools
entry.summary: Overdare looks to deliver a Roblox-like game creation experience within an open-world metaverse, built on top of the Settlus blockchain.

entry.title: One Year After the Merge: Where Does Ethereum Stand?
entry.summary: In terms of price, Ethereum is trading at approximately the same price it was when the merge happened in 2022. But that's just part of the story.

entry.title: Is Bitcoin Mining Really Greener? Here's What's Going On
entry.summary: A new report says Bitcoin mining is mostly sustainable, and that environmental FUD is "overstated."

entry.title: How to Use Yieldflow: the DeFi Protocol for Passive Growth of Digital Assets
entry.summary: While centralized exchanges expose customers to security risk in the event that they collapse, and to unpredictable liquidity, inflexible staking rules, and more, YieldFlow aims for a smooth user experience governed by trust, security, and decentralization.

entry.title: What Is Toncoin, the Native Currency of the Telegram Open Network?
entry.summary: TON uses a sharded, proof of stake consensus mechanism, meaning it can process transactions in parallel, improving transaction speed.

entry.title: Arnault Family LVMH Succession Saga: Will Pro-Crypto Sons Prevail?
entry.summary: Bernard Arnault is preparing to choose which child will inherit his $400 billion luxury empire. The decision could have major implications for crypto.

entry.title: What Are Wrapped Tokens? How They Work and What They’re Used For
entry.summary: Wrapped tokens such as WBTC help move assets across blockchains. Here’s why they matter to the crypto ecosystem.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried: 'There’s Nothing I Can Do to Make My Lifetime Impact Net Positive'
entry.summary: In 250 pages of leaked writings about the collapse of FTX, its co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried laments that he feels "broke" and "hated."

entry.title: Celsius Exec Pleads Guilty, Agrees to Cooperate in Case Against CEO
entry.summary: Former chief revenue officer Roni Cohen-Pavon reached an agreement with the U.S. Attorney’s office along with his guilty plea.

entry.title: Gods Unchained's Daniel Paez on the Future of NFT Gaming Interoperability
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, executive producer on NFT card-battling game Gods Unchained, speaks with Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward about what the future of NFT game interoperability will really look like—and what it won't.

entry.title: How Mino Games is Using Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha McKinnon tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the studio's upcoming game Dimensionals will use real-time AI.

entry.title: INTERVIEW: How Will Aurory Use NFTs and Crypto?
entry.summary: Michael Natoli, Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Aurory games will use NFTs and crypto and shares the studio's broader stance on the tech.

entry.title: Google Cloud's James Tromans on the Intersection of AI and Web3
entry.summary: Google's Global Head of Google Cloud for Web3 James Tromans sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson to discuss how AI can help Web3 companies come to market faster and the real value of Web3 tools.

entry.title: Mastering NFT Trading - Degen U
entry.summary: Take Degen U's new course, Mastering NFT Trading, and earn an on-chain certificate. A top instructor will help you identify trends, seize the right moment to trade, weed out scams—and have fun while doing it!

entry.title: Space Nation CEO on Working With 'Independence Day' Director Roland Emmerich
entry.summary: Jerome Wu, CEO of Space Nation, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the upcoming Space Nation Online game in development and shares details on Space Nation Cofounder Roland Emmerich's role in the project.

entry.title: GAME REVIEW: Champions Arena from Gala Games
entry.summary: Champions Arena is a turn-based fantasy RPG from Gala Games, where characters can become NFTs and crypto can be used to purchase gems, one of the game's synthetic currencies. Decrypt's Kate Irwin takes us inside the game for her thoughts on the fun, mobile-first title.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor Ben Prendergast on the Future of Gaming
entry.summary: Voice actor Ben Prendergast, who's voiced characters in games like Apex Legends and God of War Ragnarok, shares his opinions on the tech space's history of "bubbles" and whether blockchain gaming has a future.

entry.title: The Future of AI Stardom and Robotics With SingularityNET COO Janet Adams and Desdemona
entry.summary: In this interview, SingularityNET COO Janet Adams explains the intricate details that went into creating the Desdemona robot AI from Hanson Robotics and future plans for the AI Diva.

entry.title: Crypto a 'No-Brainer' for Video Games, Says Mino Games CEO
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.
